definition: to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for

sentences.english: They rang in a player in the game under a false name.
sentences.chinese: 他們偷偷塞進一名運動員冒名頂替參加比賽。

sentences.english: Mira Wang, to recognize his own daughter to college impostor fact.
sentences.chinese: 王崢嶸承認自己的女兒冒名頂替上大學的事實。

sentences.english: It was only a question of a trifling substitution of names.
sentences.chinese: 那不過是一件小小的冒名頂替的事罷了。
那他們就都是冒名頂替者了。

sentences.english: The presidential impersonator has not been found.
sentences.chinese: 總統的冒名頂替者尚未被找到。

sentences.english: Don't be fooled by impostors and copycats whose feeds keep getting disabled. This is the only offici…
sentences.chinese: 不要被愚弄的冒名頂替者和抄襲的飼料不斷得到禁用。

sentences.english: Remove the likes of the imposter.
The representative of register.com then sent the imposter a security code that he had to provide.
sentences.chinese: 的人員隨後請冒名頂替者提供所需的安全碼。

sentences.english: We discovered him to be an imposter.
sentences.chinese: 我們發現他是個冒名頂替的騙子。

sentences.english: The imposter is not even in the photo.
sentences.chinese: 該冒名頂替者甚至沒有在照片。
